author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Tamil Nadu unit of Lok Satta Party, instituted by bureaucrat Jayaprakash Narayanan, unveiled its election manifesto, promising free education and universal healthcare.

The party, which contested in 29 seats in 2011 State elections, barely made a dent as it polled just 0.08 per cent of the total votes in the State.

D. Jagadeeswaran, State president, said that the party would contest the election along with student leaders, community leaders and academics under the alliance called Pudhiya Sakthi Ani. “We have identified credible people across Tamil Nadu. We will put up candidates who can really change society,” he said.

Asked if the party would align with any major parties, he said that the party would not go with the DMK or the AIADMK. “They both are corrupt and we want to create space for an alternative,” Mr. Jagadeeswaran said.

He also ruled out joining the People’s Welfare Front on the account that they are against ‘free market economics.’ “Our party advocates liberal economy and liberal politics. We will never side with the Communists,” he said.
title: Lok Satta Party says ‘no’ to PWF
